name: WordPress Emoji Remover & Sanitizer
author: PrajnaBytes

sections.description:
WordPress Emoji Remover & Sanitizer helps you disable and remove the in-built WordPress Emoji feature by clearing the JavaScript and CSS from the wp-head. In addition, WordPress Emoji Remover & Sanitizer also helps you to:

  1. Remove Emoji CSS from admin-dashboard and wp-head.
  2. Remove Emoji wp-include/js/emoji.js from admin-dashboard and wp-head.
  3. Clear emoji lines from wp-head.

Plugin Settings

By default, all the options are enabled. To disable any option, navigate to Settings > Emoji Sanitizer, select/deselect the desired option(s) and click Save Changes.
sections.installation:
• Download wp-emoji-sanitizer.zip from https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-emoji-sanitizer.zip.
  • Upload “wp-emoji-sanitizer” to the “/wp-content/plugins/” directory.
  • Activate the plugin through the “Plugins” menu in WordPress.
sections.changelog:

  • Updated version to 2.3
  • Tested up to WordPress 6.6
  • Improved code compatibility

2.2

  • Updated version to 2.2
  • Tested up to WordPress 6.4.1
  • Made compatible with PHP 8.1

2.1

  • Added options to disable emoji detection script, styles, static emojis, TinyMCE emojis, and DNS prefetch.
  • Improved performance and code structure.

2.0

  • Added settings option to enable and disable functions.
  • Modified code to comply with PHP version 7.4 and 8.0+.

1.0.1

  • Updated Tested up to to WordPress 6.2.2
  • Bug fix

1.0.0

  • Updated Tested up to to WordPress 6.2
  • Introduced Plugin Settings to enable/disable features
  • Store settings in the database and on uninstall remove stored data of the plugin

0.4.9

  • Tested and added support for the latest WordPress version 6.0.2

0.4.8

  • Readme file syntax fix and Tested and Upgraded version to support WordPress 5.9.2

  • Introduced init() to remove emojis
  • Removed CSS elements for better SEO from wp_head, admin dashboard, comment, and TINY MCE

0.1
